channel.title: Stressbot317
channel.description:
Just a simple socket flooder I made for testing performance. It sends dummy data to avoid timing out but there's no actual packet structure to the data yet, I'll add support for sending actual packets later on. I know the GUI is a bit ugly and I apologize.
[spoiler][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/oZFFycm.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/pN146n0.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/0oyg9pP.png[/img][/spoiler]
You can download it in an executable JAR file or you can use the source.
[url=http://up.ht/1ppWvR1]Executable JAR[/url] [url=https://github.com/lare96/Stressbot317]Source code[/url]

item.title: Stressbot317
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

hadlich4:

So does this see how much the server can handle?

yes it will log on however many bots you want it to and the bots will perform basic I/O operations (reading from and writing to the server) in order to stay online. its basically does what rune-rebels but doesn’t have proper packet support yet (so the bots won’t walk or talk)

Read full topic

item.title: Stressbot317
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

jummppy:

I like this. Once you get the packet structure will these be able to walk around etc?

yeah, walk, talk, commands, drop items, pickup items basically any incoming packets that can be read by the server
